name: Computing for Engineering Technology

timeGuidelines.description: The standard instructional time for this course is 60 hours.

description: This applied computer course provides students with critical electronic communications, data and file management skills, along with a strong focus on using common productivity applications to format, calculate, analyze, visualize, and present or report data and information. Industry standard project management principles are implemented throughout the course from a digital perspective, so students can have an appreciation for how computing skills relate to real world business processes.

learningOutcomes.title: Manage data retrieved from the internet, email, or other documents
objectives: Practice ethical, legal and responsible digital citizenship
Conduct research to aid with critical thinking and problem solving
Create a file management system and naming conventions aligned to industry best practices
Use digital tools to organize tasks, meetings, and activities
Apply best practices to help ensure digital privacy and security
Use various communication tools in compliance with standard business protocols

learningOutcomes.title: Apply project management principles
objectives: Define a project
Determine project scope
Discuss the principles of classical management vs project management
Explain the elements of a project life cycle
Identify the components in a Project Plan
Describe the components of the Project Management System

learningOutcomes.title: Develop a project schedule using project management software
objectives: Setup a new project
Enter project tasks
Create the project calendar to reflect work schedule
Determine task durations and milestones
Create a baseline

learningOutcomes.title: Establish effective task relationships applying time constraints using project management software
objectives: Explain the relationship between time, cost, and quality elements
Organize project tasks into phases
Distinguish between types of task relationships
Create task relationships
Apply time constraints
Display critical path on the Gantt Chart

learningOutcomes.title: Manage resource workloads with associated expenses using project management software
objectives: Allocate project resources
Assign costs to resources
Level resources

learningOutcomes.title: Analyze a project's progress
objectives: Use a Gantt Chart to track project progress
Compare actual progress vs. baseline projections
Adjust the schedule to meet project goals
Update actual work completed
Generate project status reports

learningOutcomes.title: Create industry specific documentation and presentations
objectives: Apply standard software features to prepare industry specific documentation
Demonstrate how to import, export, and link external sources to achieve engaging and interactive documents
Use software functionality to visually enhance documentation and presentations

learningOutcomes.title: Analyze, organize, and visualize data and information using industry standard software
objectives: Perform industry related calculations using conventional software
Organize data into logical structures and meaningful layouts
Prepare charts, graphs, and other application visualizations of data

assessment.description: Course Assessment: Assessments 70%, Exam(s) 25%, Core Abilities 5%, Total: 100%

schedule.topics: M1: Computer and operating system functionality, File management best practices / cloud technologies
Introduction to Microsoft Outlook, Calendar / Appointments
Digital security / citizenship, Review of Microsoft 365
schedule.assessments: Computer Skills Assignment (13%), Computer Skills Exam (6%)

schedule.topics: M2: Introduction to spreadsheets, Formatting worksheets, Layout and printing spreadsheets
Basic formulas / functions, Intermediate formulas / functions
VLOOKUP and XLOOKUP functions, IF statement, Conditional formatting, Data Validation
PivotTables, Macros, Review for Spreadsheet Exam
M3: Introduction to presentation software, Presentation best practices, Data Visualization and Dashboards
M4: Overview of word processing fundamentals, Page and section breaks, Header / footer, Referencing, Footnotes / end notes
M5: Introduction to MS Project, Adding/editing tasks and related properties, Adding and assigning resources, Updating the project timeline
Setting baselines and comparing to actuals, Creating reports, Reviewing

schedule.assessments: Project Management Concepts Exam (5%), Project Scheduling Assignment (11%)
